data.title: Matt Hancock – Page 4 – POLITICO
data.meta_description: Matt Hancock MP has been Secretary of State for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport since January 2018. Before that, he was Minister of State for Digital from July 2016 to January 2018. Hancock entered government in September 2012 and has served in a number of Ministerial Roles, including for skills and business, and as Paymaster General. He oversaw the expansion of apprenticeships and championed the digital transformation of government. He was elected Member of the Parliament for West Suffolk in the 2010 general election where he served as a backbencher on the Public Accounts Committee and the Standards & Privileges Committee. Before entering politics, he worked as an economist at the Bank of England, and as Chief of Staff to the Shadow Chancellor of the Exchequer. Hancock holds degrees from Oxford and Cambridge Universities.
data.text:
UK to require two additional coronavirus tests upon arrival

British government toughens up travel restrictions to prevent spread of emerging variants.

‘No reason to think’ South Africa strain will become dominant in UK, says adviser

Early data suggest coronavirus variant lacks ‘distinct transmissibility advantage,’ says Jonathan Van-Tam.

UK arrivals from virus hotspots face hotel quarantine from February 15

Hotels near ports and airports asked to run as quarantine facilities from middle of the month.

Britain’s top medical adviser shrugs off street abuse over coronavirus

Chris Whitty said he hoped man who shouted at him in street would become a ‘model citizen’.

UK bids to contain South African coronavirus strain with door-to-door tests

Enhanced testing is expected to cover some 80,000 people.

UK weighs vaccine export restrictions

The move follows fears that vaccines produced in the UK could be diverted to the EU.

Timeline: How the UK responded to the coronavirus

From insisting masks and lockdowns ‘aren’t any use’ to canceling Christmas, here’s how London has handled the COVID-19 pandemic.

Europe faces identity crisis over vaccine trade war

Free-trading Eurocrats want to avoid protectionism but are facing strong political headwinds.

Boris Johnson to EU: Don’t restrict vaccine exports

UK prime minister urges Brussels not to go against spirit of ‘multinational cooperation.’

Rich countries ‘hoarding’ vaccines, says South Africa’s president

Cyril Ramaphosa calls on wealthy nations to distribute excess vaccine doses.

Johnson: UK did ‘everything’ to limit coronavirus deaths as 100K recorded

The prime minister led a somber press conference in Downing Street.
